title_sort: walt whitman to richard maurice bucke, 24 january 1891
title: Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 24 January 1891
text: CamdenSat: early PM Jan 24'91Herbert Gilchrist comes & takes lunch with me—he goes to NY Monday—& soon returns to his hermitage Centreport LI—Eakins' portrait WW is among the great show Penn: Art Exhibition Phila—Horace T goes to NY this afternoon—returning Monday—Scribner's has rejected & returned to me my offered poems—the 1 o'clock whistle is just peeling cheerily—I am feeling half-and-half—had a pretty fair night—b'kfast raw oysters—have read Horace's piece in March Lip[pincott's] satisfactory, probably best he has written ab't me & I like it—(a little too markedly eulogistic may-be) he is a faithful friend—JM Stoddart the editor Lip: seems to be another—I enclose a warm friendly letter just rec'd f'm our Bolton friends—Walt WhitmanY'rs of 22d ab't the little law suit &c: rec'd— Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 24 January 1891
